member.name: T:Terrasoft.Core.Compilation.ProcessReaper
member.summary: Responsible for reaping a target process if the current process terminates.
member.remarks:
See https://github.com/dotnet/cli; src/Microsoft.DotNet.Cli.Utils/ProcessReaper.cs
On Windows, a job object will be used to ensure the termination of the target process (and its tree) even if the current process is rudely terminated.
On POSIX systems, the reaper will handle SIGTERM and attempt to forward the signal to the target process only.
The reaper also suppresses SIGINT in the current process to allow the target process to handle the signal.

member.summary: Creates a new process reaper.
member.param: The target process to reap if the current process terminates. The process should not yet be started.
